title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: cbRt R interface Electronic Data Delivery System (EDDS) Central Bank Republic Turkey (CBRT). “system provides rich range economic data information support economic education foster economic research.”[1]

title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: See etaymaz/CBRT

title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: can install cbRt github :

title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: two functions package. cbrt_meta retrieves information series. token argument see definition . returns tibble. One can search tibble find series IDs information series. function cbrt_get retrieves data EDDS. Following arguments used functions. Descriptions taken EDDS Web Service Usage Guide. Note , series, start_date, end_date, token required arguments.
code: series_meta_info <- cbrt_meta(token = NULL) cbrt_get(series, start_date, end_date, formulas, token = NULL, nd = TRUE,          as = c("tibble", "tsibble", "data.frame", "data.table"))

title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: series argument can obtained CBRT webpage. Search CBRT webpage order find series code use series argument. example, TP.DK.USD.code (USDTRY) US Dollar (Buying) Exchange Rate. One can also use cbrt_meta function get information series search resulting tibble. Argument can take multiple values.

title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: start_date argument series start date dd-mm-yyyy format. argument takes single value.

title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: end_date argument series end date dd-mm-yyyy format. argument takes single value.

title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: formulas argument formula applied series. Available formulas ; 0: Level 1: Percentage Change 2: Difference 3: Year--year Percent Change 4: Year--year Differences 5: Percentage Change Compared End--Previous Year 6: Difference Compared End--Previous Year 7: Moving Average 8: Moving Sum parameter supplied user, level formula parameter applied relevant series. retrieving multiple series, argument take multiple values.

title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: token argument required API key. Follow instructions CBRT webpage obtain user specific API key. argument takes single value. can set token can add .Renviron file

title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: nd argument TRUE FALSE argument. Data retrieved sometimes includes ND terms. nd set TRUE (default), NDs converted NAs.

title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: argument class output. Available classes ; tibble tsibble data.frame data.table tibble default output class.

title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: Following example retrieves (USDTRY) US Dollar (Buying) Exchange Rate.

title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: Following example retrieves multiple different series different frequencies. EDDS API converts series common frequency requested together frequency argument given. example, request one yearly one monthly series, API return series yearly values. Package, hand, sends independent queries series joins together without changing frequency. opted include freq argument function call. example also shows usage formulas argument. NOTE API call returns empty columns. cbrt_get function also removes .
code: start_date <- "01-01-2017" end_date <- "01-01-2020" series <- c("TP.AB.B1", "TP.AB.C2", "TP.BKEA.S001", "TP.KB.O06.TRL") formulas <- c(2, 3, 7, 8) token <- Sys.getenv("EVDS_TOKEN") # Get token from .Renviron  # data(cbrt_meta_data) # cbrt_meta_data %>%  #   dplyr::filter(SERIE_CODE %in% series) %>%  #   dplyr::select(SERIE_CODE, FREQUENCY_STR) #  #      SERIE_CODE  FREQUENCY_STR # 1      TP.AB.C2 HAFTALIK(CUMA) # 2      TP.AB.B1          AYLIK # 3  TP.BKEA.S001       ÜÇ AYLIK # 4 TP.KB.O06.TRL         YILLIK  # EDDS API returns following url <- paste0("https://evds2.tcmb.gov.tr/service/evds/series=TP.AB.B1-TP.AB.C2-TP.BKEA.S001-TP.KB.O06.TRL&startDate=01-01-2017&endDate=01-01-2020&type=json", "&formulas=2-3-7-8")  (edds_dat <- cbRt:::cbrt_geturl(url, token = token) %>%     httr::content(as = "text", encoding = "UTF-8") %>%      jsonlite::fromJSON() %>%     .[["items"]] %>%     tibble::as_tibble()) #> # A tibble: 4 × 10 #>   Tarih `TP_AB_B1-2` `TP_AB_C2-3`        `TP_BKEA_S001-7` `TP_KB_O06_TRL-8` #>   <chr> <chr>        <chr>               <chr>            <chr>             #> 1 2017  9485.7       -8.625746876697447  0                343279699.6       #> 2 2018  -3407        -14.421590773986445 -20.3            399316709.55      #> 3 2019  6957         12.864684634620726  57.1             471538564.43      #> 4 2020  16466        -38.49704579025111  1.2              144592850         #> # ℹ 5 more variables: UNIXTIME <df[,1]>, TP_AB_B1 <lgl>, TP_AB_C2 <lgl>, #> #   TP_BKEA_S001 <lgl>, TP_KB_O06_TRL <lgl> (dat <- cbrt_get(series, start_date, end_date, as = "tsibble")) #> # A tsibble: 188 x 5 [1D] #>    Date       TP_AB_B1 TP_AB_C2 TP_BKEA_S001 TP_KB_O06_TRL #>    <date>        <dbl>    <dbl>        <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 2017-01-01    15933       NA            0    343279700. #>  2 2017-01-06       NA    96933           NA           NA  #>  3 2017-01-13       NA    95292           NA           NA  #>  4 2017-01-20       NA    92296           NA           NA  #>  5 2017-01-27       NA    92517           NA           NA  #>  6 2017-02-01    16648       NA           NA           NA  #>  7 2017-02-03       NA    91522           NA           NA  #>  8 2017-02-10       NA    92798           NA           NA  #>  9 2017-02-17       NA    89049           NA           NA  #> 10 2017-02-24       NA    91088           NA           NA  #> # ℹ 178 more rows

title: R Interface to EDDS of CBRT
text: Following examples data location attributes. Series Hedonic House Price Index (HHPI)(2010=100)(CBRT)(Monthly). TP.HKFE02 TP.HKFE03 price indices codes Istanbul Ankara, respectively. series can used draw maps. time support package though.

title: _PACKAGE cbRt — cbRt
text: R Interface CBRT EDDS

title: _PACKAGE cbRt — cbRt
text: Electronic Data Delivery System (EDDS) dynamic interactive system presents statistical time series data produced Central Bank Republic Turkey (CBRT) /data produced institutions compiled CBRT. Datasets can accessed cbRt functions.

what: Get the series from CBRT — cbrt_get
title: Get the series from CBRT — cbrt_get
text: Get series CBRT

title: Get the series from CBRT — cbrt_get
code: cbrt_get(   series,   start_date,   end_date,   formulas = NULL,   token = NULL,   nd = TRUE,   as = c("tibble", "tsibble", "data.frame", "data.table") )

title: Get the series from CBRT — cbrt_get
text: series Series Code series argument can obtained CBRT webpage. Search CBRT webpage order find series code use series argument. serial codes displayed. one series selected, takes parameters number series, serial codes separated "-" sign. start_date Start date start_date argument series start date dd-mm-yyyy format. order display frequency desired series, first day corresponding frequency must stated start date dd-mm-yyyy format. end_date End date end_date argument series end date dd-mm-yyyy format. formulas Formulas applied series formulas argument formula applied series. Available formulas ; 0: Level 1: Percentage change 2: Difference 3: Year--year Percent Change 4: Year--year Differences 5: Percentage Change Compared End--Previous Year 6: Difference Compared End--Previous Year 7: Moving Average 8: Moving Sum one series selected, takes parameters number series, serial codes separated "-" sign. parameter entered user, level formula parameter applied relevant series. token API key token argument required API key. See https://evds2.tcmb.gov.tr/help/videos/EVDS_Web_Service_Usage_Guide.pdf instructions obtain API key. nd Convert ND values NA nd argument TRUE FALSE argument. Data retrieved sometimes includes ND terms. nd set TRUE, NDs converted NAs. Type data return Argument can set either tibble, tsibble, data.frame, data.table obtain different types data classes. tibble default output class.

title: Get the series from CBRT — cbrt_get
text: data frame (tibble, tsibble, data.frame, data.table)

title: Get the series from CBRT — cbrt_get
code: # Download the given series for the given dates if (FALSE) cbrt_get(series = "TP.DK.USD.A",                   start_date = "01-01-2017",                   end_date = "01-01-2018",                   token = APIkey) # \dontrun{}
